item.title: Auto Clicker
item.dc:creator: @Tarantula Tarantula
item.description:
@Tarantula wrote:

[quote=“Janilabo, post:4, topic:9194”][quote author=p a r t y b o y link=topic=13122.msg148975#msg148975 date=1155417979]
wow we can just use ghost mouse dude whats the point of this script.
[/quote]LEARNING PURPOSES!

Good job Tarantula! Nice nice.[/quote]

Thanks JaniLabo!
p a r t y b o y try to get it. We just want to script.

[quote=“Home, post:5, topic:9194”]I maded one too Ok i maded this for fun… taked 5 secs

[scar]program AmazingClicker;
var h,x,y :integer;

procedure DisguiseScar(disguise: String);
begin
GetApplication.Title:= disguise;
GetSelf.Caption:= disguise;
end;

procedure Lol;
begin
repeat
GetMousepos(x,y)
clickmouse(x,y,true)
wait(1000)
h:=h+ 1;
DisguiseScar('Clicked ’ + IntToStr(h) + ’ Times. ');
until(false)
end;

begin
lol;
end.[/scar]

POST PROGRESS REPORTS :P[/quote]

Very nice homie, but when you are using GetMousePos(x,y) people can ruin the script by just moving mouse to wrong position And for me, if it take mousepos before each click, mouse can move itself like 1pixel to up or/and left after each GetMousePos.

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:8, topic:9194”]I made one for fun, Like Home.

[code]
Const TBetween = 100;
Const Many = 100;
Const x = 516;
Const y = 261;

var i, a, St: Integer;
begin
St:= GetSystemTime;
repeat
HoldMouse(x, y, True);
for a:= 1 to 4 do
begin
Wait(5 + Random(4));
end;
ReleaseMouse(x, y, True);
i:= i + 1;
ClearDebug;
Writeln('Clicked ’ + inttostr(i) + ‘/’ + inttostr(Many));
Writeln(‘Worked For ’ + floattostr((GetSystemTime-St)/1000) + ’ Seconds.’);
Wait((TBetween-Random(TBetween/3) + Random(TBetween/3)));
until(i >= Many);
end.
[/code][/quote]

And XxKanexX thats INCREDIBLE i love that how many times to click option

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Clicker
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

I made one for fun, Like Home. 

Const TBetween = 100;
Const Many = 100;
Const x = 516;
Const y = 261;

var i, a, St: Integer;
begin
  St:= GetSystemTime;
  repeat
    HoldMouse(x, y, True);
    for a:= 1 to 4 do
    begin
      Wait(5 + Random(4));
    end;
    ReleaseMouse(x, y, True);
    i:= i + 1;
    ClearDebug;
    Writeln('Clicked ' + inttostr(i) + '/' + inttostr(Many));
    Writeln('Worked For ' + floattostr((GetSystemTime-St)/1000) + ' Seconds.');
    Wait((TBetween-Random(TBetween/3) + Random(TBetween/3)));
  until(i >= Many);
end.

[scar]program AmazingClicker;
var h,x,y :integer;

procedure DisguiseScar(disguise: String);
begin
GetApplication.Title:= disguise;
GetSelf.Caption:= disguise;
end;

procedure Lol;
begin
repeat
GetMousepos(x,y)
clickmouse(x,y,true)
wait(1000)
h:=h+ 1;
DisguiseScar('Clicked ’ + IntToStr(h) + ’ Times. ');
until(false)
end;

begin
lol;
end.[/scar]

POST PROGRESS REPORTS

item.title: Auto Clicker
item.dc:creator: @Tarantula Tarantula
item.description:
@Tarantula wrote:

Ok this is simple macro for mouse clicking.
Use to whatever you want to.

# ScriptName = Auto Clicker # Author = Tarantula # Description = Macro for mouse clicking # Version = 1.0 # Date = 12.8.2006 # Comments = Have Fun :)

Ok, there you go
Auto Clicker By Tarantula:

[code]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = Auto Clicker

Author = Tarantula

Description = Macro for mouse clicking

Version = 1.0

Date = 12.8.2006

Comments = Have Fun

/Script Info}

program AutoClicker;

const
TimeBetweenClicks = 5000; // 1000ms = 1sec
RandomTime = 0; // + Random Time To Wait [If wanted]
NoobX = 666; // ADD X COORDINATE HERE!
NoobY = 101; // ADD Y COORDINATE HERE!
progress = 1; // Minutes To Wait For Next Progress Report

var
x,y :integer;
Clicked :integer;

procedure LetsClick;
begin
clickmouse(NoobX,NoobY,true);
Clicked:= Clicked + 1;
wait(TimeBetweenClicks+random(RandomTime));
end;

Procedure ProgressReport;
begin
ClearDebug;
Writeln(’-------------------------------------’);
Writeln(’ Thank You For Using ‘);
Writeln(’ Tarantula’‘s Auto Clicker!’ );
Writeln(’ Times Clicked: ’ + IntToStr(Clicked));
writeln(’-------------------------------------’);
end;

begin
repeat
SetTimeOut(progress * 60,‘ProgressReport’);
ActivateClient;
LetsClick;
ProgressReport;
until(false);
end.[/code]

[glow=red,2,300]
ps. stelij4 on homo

~Tarantula

Read full topic
